timeline.bodyText: why is the group gone? We do need to know the group for when we handle multi-group deployments
timeline.author: MikeDombo

replies.bodyText: Right. I'll add it back. It's not used for now, but should be parsed from the configurationArn.
replies.author: hui-yang

timeline.bodyText: will this todo be done for this PR?
timeline.author: MikeDombo

replies.bodyText: Separately. I can integrate now with http request. Will try to get SDK for the actual integration.
replies.author: hui-yang

timeline.bodyText: I'd probably put "mock" somewhere in the name since, even though it is in the E2E folder (which uses real accounts), this arn isn't real.
timeline.author: MikeDombo

timeline.bodyText: Will this be the time when config was drafted or when the job was triggered? Is this in alignment with the experience we needed around timestamps?
timeline.author: shaguptashaikh

replies.bodyText: This is when config was drafted. I thought about this actually. It seems ok to me because in FCS, customers cannot publish an older draft (as in deployment). I cannot imagine a case (at least not in prod, maybe possible in dev), where customer creates a draft, make some config changes in kernel in whichever way, and then publish the draft for deployment.
replies.author: hui-yang

timeline.bodyText: I used deploymentId to create snapshot files for rollbacks, it might be a bit odd to have an arn in the file name, but technically it doesn't sound like an issue so I'm okay with this for this PR
timeline.author: shaguptashaikh

replies.bodyText: Arns have characters that we shouldn't have in a file name. This needs to be fixed.
replies.author: MikeDombo

replies.bodyText: Yes. I talked to Fengyi a few times. He doesn't want to pass a deploymentId to device unless we have a good reason, though a deploymentId is generated in the cloud for tracing logs anyway. But this can always be changed IMO.
replies.author: hui-yang

replies.bodyText: How will logs be traced if the deployment id is not present in device logs that were streamed to CW? using the arn? is sending one UUID in the doc that big a deal?
replies.author: shaguptashaikh

replies.bodyText: Also I wonder how the rollback test passed if the filename is really problematic
replies.author: shaguptashaikh

replies.bodyText:
I'll try follow up again. deploymentId is currently intended to looking up service logs.
Good point on the test... I'll check what happens during the test.
replies.author: hui-yang

replies.bodyText: The path appears to work. {path=/tmp/junit6723446930195798793/config/rollback_snapshot_arn:aws:gg:test-region:1234567890:configuration:test/mock:1.tlog} But I will still update it.
replies.author: hui-yang

replies.bodyText: I'm pretty sure that : isn't allowed on windows, so definitely should change that.
replies.author: MikeDombo

replies.bodyText: Currently deploymentId is not stored in service DDB and cannot be used in FCS requests. Probably not a good indication of what the snapshot contains.
replies.author: hui-yang

timeline.bodyText: Do we plan to keep this wrapper or is it temporary to avoid refactoring? Why not replace the contents of DeploymentDocument with that of FleetConfiguration?
timeline.author: shaguptashaikh

replies.bodyText: Initial intention was to avoid conflicts with local deployment. @leaf94 then brought up the idea to keep DeploymentDocument as our internal interface, not bundled with cloud contracts. I think it's worth a discussion after the demo and maybe we can refactor then.
replies.author: hui-yang
